result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Devon Virginia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 7-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the time now being served.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Devon Virginia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction - concurrent with time now being served; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 7-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Kevin Devon Virginia not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in custody.  Paul Hauer for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  
Defendant Kevin Devon Virginia in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin Devon Virginia
Current: 3044 N 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 03-07-2015)
Prior: Lka:  2909 West Clarke Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
